channel.title: Remove uncessary packages from Whonix-KVM
channel.description: Hello, I noticed in Whonix-KVM gateway we currently have pipewire AND pulseaudio even if the user assigns low ram (256 mb or lower) which doesn't make sense since gateway does not need audio, it hell sure does not need pipewire over pulseaudio either.

item.title: Remove uncessary packages from Whonix-KVM
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Gateway has audio support for accessibility support. → Orca Screen Reader
(Whonix is based on Kicksecure.)

The duplication pulseaudio + pipewire is because of dependency hell. Possible gdm3 might might be gone in the next release.

pulseaudio / pipewire might also be fully gone in favor of ALSA on day:

Switching to ALSA Development
The honorable @madaidan has pitched this suggestion because it is still updated and less of a problem to isolate with sandboxing. Questions are : is it easy to uninstall pulseaudio? Is there anything important that depends on it? How much space do we save? - If none then maybe it is not worth the bother. I remember at some point TBB refused to use anything but pulseaudio so this needs to be re-examined. Discuss.

item.title: Remove uncessary packages from Whonix-KVM
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Assigning less RAM doesn’t result in removing any packages. It’s still the same Whonix-Gateway KVM Xfce but the desktop environment does not get booted.

  • Whonix for VirtualBox: There is Whonix-Gateway VirtualBox CLI.
  • Whonix for KVM: Whonix KVM maintainer @HulaHoop does not provide Whonix-Gateway KVM CLI downloadable binary builds. Advanced users could attempt to build these from source code.
